intro: Ipomoea scabrida, commonly known as rough morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant has rough, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, and it often grows as a climbing vine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Ipomoea scabrida is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread aggressively in certain environments.
